Description.val: This line item funds modifications to the (11) VH-3D, (8) VH-60N, (1) UH-3D, and (1) UH-60N, currently in service. Initial Sundown efforts for these aircraft are to begin at the end of FY 2020 with the majority of the aircraft retirements in FY 2022-2023. However, the overall goal of the modifications budgeted in FY 2020 are to continue procurement efforts in accordance with the procurement strategy to maintain the VH-3D and VH-60N until the VH-92A Replacement Helicopter becomes fully operationally capable. The Communication Suite Upgrade consists of the incorporation of the Wide Band Line of Sight capability.  The Structural Enhancement Program incorporates a Service Life Extension on the VH-3D and VH-60N. The Obsolescence Management Program will manage impending Executive Helicopter obsolescence issues. A variety of factors will be addressed including communication, navigation, operational weight, safety, and engine upgrades to remain mission relevant. The VH-92A Improvement Program provides for the preparation and incorporation of Engineering Change Proposals (ECP) that are based on added capability and correction of deficiencies, and the implementation of those changes to sustain and improve VH-92A operations.

Justification.val: In FY20, the Wide Band Line of Sight (WBLoS) will be continuing Phase IV of the effort for seamless transitions between Ground Entry Points, and implements Through the Rotors capability in order to provide greater access to the NC2/3 networks and provide a robust Fault Isolation/Fault Detection system to the user. The Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) procurement and installations started in FY17 and will run through FY23. The SLEP effort is being installed in parallel with the Special Progressive Aircraft Rework (SPAR) effort, and must follow the SPAR schedule. The VH-3D Cabin Interior modification will complete installation efforts in FY20.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Contractor Field Mod Team:: Installation Name: VH-60 Comm Upgrade (WBLoS) Hydra Light Systems

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  In support of the Senior Leaders Communications, a Wideband Line of Sight (WBLoS) system is required.  A new radio, antenna, associated accessories, aircraft Operational Flight Programs (OFP) and aircraft integration will be required for this effort and procurement efforts began in FY16. Phase III of the four phase WBLoS effort began in FY17 and included the Non Recurring Engineering (NRE) for an upgraded software OFP that will provide the capability for a single WBLoS Terminal to communicate with more than one Ground Entry Point (GEP) at a time in order to minimize transition time between GEPs. It also included the testing and verification of that software. Phase IV, beginning FY19, includes a network upgrade to reduce anticipated packet routing delays due to limitations of Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) protocol when transitioning from GEP to GEP, and support the VH requirement of seamless transitions between GEPs. Development and deployment of enhanced capabilities through phases (via software and modifications to the radio and/ or ground equipment) continue after initial installations. Prior year efforts include the FM (YZ) radio replacements on the VH-3D and VH-60N aircraft to maintain crypto security requirements, as well as all related software/firmware modifications. On 22 April 2016, the WBLoS effort received a Deputy Assistant Secretary of the Navy signed exception to the prohibitions of 10 USC 2244a relating to the modification of aircraft within five years of retirement or disposal. WBLoS consists of two systems: Hydra Light and Crisis Management.  The Hydra Light kit consists of a radio and amplifier (RFE) that provide the means for a Voice over IP (VoIP) call to be made using the Phoenix Air-to-Ground Communications Network (PAGCN) structure.  The Crisis Management system is the Router, Call Manger and High Assurance Internet Protocol Encryptor (HAIPE) required to connect into the TS/SCI network controlled by DISA.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  In FY13, the Deputy Secretary of Defense (DEPSECDEF) initiated the requirement for the WBLoS capability. Research and development efforts began in FY14 for this effort; the procurement efforts began in FY16. Non recurring engineering efforts for Phase III began in FY17. Phase IV software upgrades begin in FY19.


Notes:
1. The Communication Upgrade (WBLoS) A-kits are being installed via a contractor field modification team.

Name.@footnote: The Other Support across the FYDP includes labor for the installation of the SLEP kits during SPAR.
One VH-60N SLEP Kit procured in FY15 is was previously installed as the validation kit in FY17.

Name.val: Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation - VH Service Life Extension Program VH-60N
Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation - VH Service Life Extension Program VH-3D

ImplementationMethodName.val: Contractor Field Mod Team:: Installation Name: VH-60N SLEP Kits
Contractor Field Mod Team:: Installation Name: VH-3D SLEP Kits

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  The VH Structural Enhancement Program consists of the efforts to implement aircraft safety of flight structural modifications to extend the service lives of the VH-3D and VH-60N airframes.  The VH-3D and VH-60N must stay in service to support mission needs until the completion of the fielding of the VH-92A aircraft.  In order to meet the usage requirements, a Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) was established to implement the safety of flight upgrades identified in the Service Life Assessment Program (SLAP).  The SLEP extends the service life of the VH-60N and VH-3D by 4,000 hours.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Non-Recurring Engineering for the VH-3D and VH-60N Service Life Extensions began in FY12.  The VH-3D SLEP kits were procured in FY13 via a Life of Type procurement due to lack of component part availability.  The VH-60N SLEP Kit procurement began in FY15.  Validation and Verification efforts occurred in FY17. Installs are to follow the Special Progressive Aircraft Rework (SPAR) schedule which began in FY18.

Notes:
1. VH-60N Kits have a 11 month production lead time. Kits must be available prior to the aircraft being inducted into SPAR. 
2. The Other Support across the FYDP includes labor for the installation of the SLEP kits during SPAR.

Archived Kits
VH-3D Cabin Interior Redesign Equipment

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  
This Operational, Safety, and Improvement Program provides for the readiness of the VH-3D and VH-60N Presidential Helicopters. Funds will be utilized to manage and prepare, process, and incorporate Engineering Change Proposals (ECP) and implement changes to sustain and improve all Executive Helicopter Series system readiness including safety, mission availability, structural integrity, component (avionics/systems) reliability, maintainability, operational weight, performance, and obsolescence conditions as they arise. This program contains the upgrade of Air Vehicle Support Equipment and technical data to support VH unique Air Vehicle requirements. This upgrade effort will install new operating systems, replace obsolete components and core computers, test equipment and basic test program hardware.  The Cabin Interior upgrade program for the VH-3D reduces aircraft operational weight, replaces obsolete electrical components, upgrades the  fuel system and improves maintainability. Cabin Interior installation efforts include the depopulation of the aircraft and removal of current aircraft interior to ready the aircraft for the installation of the new interior kit, as well as the installation of the new interior kit. As of 18 February 2016, the VH-3D Cabin Interior Modification effort received a Deputy Assistant Secretary of the Navy signed exception to the prohibitions of 10 USC 2244a relating to the modification of aircraft within five years of retirement or disposal.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: VH-3D Cabin Interior Upgrade Non-Recurring Engineering efforts began in FY14. The validation kit procurement was contracted in FY14 and was delivered in FY16. The validation installation was completed in FY17. Cabin Interior kits will be installed via a contractor field modification team and on-site support at the Presidential Helicopter Support Facility in Patuxent River, MD.

DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION: In order to meet the requirement of providing safe and timely transportation for the President, Vice President, and other parties as directed by the Director of the White House Military Office (WHMO), and in support of the alert and contingency mission requirement of the WHMO Operations Plan, a VH-3D Cockpit Upgrade program has been established to extend the VH-3D service life requirements.  The VH-3D Cockpit Upgrade eliminates pending obsolescence and supportability issues with key avionics components and brings the VH-3D in compliance with mandated avionics capabilities (Communication Navigation Surveillance/Air Traffic Management, Terrain Awareness Warning System/Ground Proximity Warning System). In addition, an upgraded cockpit improves system safety, reduces pilot workload and training requirements.  The baseline upgrade includes night vision compatibility and related cockpit lighting, GPS moving map functionality, and satellite weather feed, bringing the VH-3D in line with VH-60N capabilities. Modern, common avionics equipment will reduce logistics cost and increase reliability. 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: Procurement efforts for the VH-3D Cockpit Upgrade began in FY12.  Procurement for the Cockpit Upgrade Lighting kits began in FY16. The GPS update began in FY18. Operational Flight Program Software (OFP) upgrades for the Cockpit Upgrade program are ongoing to support the upgraded hardware systems.

Notes:
1. The Cockpit Lighting Upgrade kits will be installed at O-level by the squadron at HMX-1 as aircraft are available.
2. The DTU-7000 effort within the FY18 VH-3D Cockpit Upgrade (OSIP 10-12) software line has been cancelled.

Name.@footnote: FY21 Software costs represent follow-on effort of Broad Agency Announcement for future communications capabilities currently being developed.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  The VH-92A provides  safe, reliable, and timely transportation for the President, Vice President, Foreign Heads of State (HoS), and other official parties as directed by the Director of the White House Military Office (WHMO). VH-92A Improvement Program provides near and long term improvements to the fleet, focusing on documented deficiencies related to mission systems, maintainability, and incorporates pre-planned product improvements defined in the VH-92A Capabilities Development Document update in lieu of a Capability Production Document. These modifications and selected component changes are being accomplished by depot level maintenance or field retrofit. Funds will be used to manage, prepare, process and incorporate airframe and avionics Engineering Change Proposals (ECP) based on added capability and corrections of deficiencies, and implement those changes to sustain and improve VH-92A operations. ECPs will be implemented to coincide with resources and aircraft availability. The planned efforts are the forward airstair door modification, Mission Communications System (MCS) follow-on efforts, and incorporation of a fifth multi-function display panel in the cockpit, which is one additional center display, identical to the four existing screens, to increase situational awareness inside the aircraft. Other efforts include Shipboard Interoperability to allow Shipboard Operations, and an Enhanced Visual System (EVS). The forward airstair door requires retrofit to raise the outboard edge of the door to a position equal to or above the aircraft door frame opening when fully open to ensure the door is at or above the Water Line (WL) 256 when fully opened. ASDB Out efforts are to comply with Federal Aviation Administration mandates to improve aircraft navigation in national airspace. Enhanced visual systems are improvements required to increase situational awareness outside of the aircraft during flight operations.

Funding throughout the FYDP is for correction of deficiencies. Individual mods will be broken out as they are approved. 


DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: The Milestone B Acquisition Decision Memorandum was signed 17 April 2014 and the VH-92A contract for the Engineering and Manufacturing Development (EMD) phase and priced options for production was awarded on 7 May 2014.  Four System Demonstration Test Articles (SDTA) aircraft will be delivered during EMD and will be used for Initial Operational Test and Evaluation (IOT&E).  The SDTA aircraft will be transitioned to operational use after completion of IOT&E in FY20.  This OSIP is a new start in FY21 to begin improvements and modifications to the SDTA aircraft and subsequent VH-92A aircraft after they are delivered.  The VH-92A program will have a total of 21 operational aircraft by FY23.  Kits in FY21 are for the first four LRIP aircraft.

VH-3D Lift Improvement Program (LIP) OSIP 011-06 completed in FY 2012 and has been moved to In-Active OSIPs.
VH-60N Cockpit Upgrade OSIP 009-02 completed in FY 2016 and has been moved to In-Active OSIPs.
VH-3D/VH-60N Trainer Conversion OSIP 009-11 completed in FY 2016 and has been moved to In-Active OSIPs.
